question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
If March 1 is a Monday, what day of the week will it be 270 days later?
inference:
March has 31 days.
April has 30 days.
May has 31 days.
June has 30 days.
July has 31 days.
August has 31 days.
September has 30 days.
October has 31 days.
November has 30 days.
December has 31 days.
270 days from March 1st.
March: 31 - 1 = 30 days left
April: 30 days
May: 31 days
June: 30 days
July: 31 days
August: 31 days
September: 30 days
October: 31 days
Days from March 1st to March 31st = 30
Days from April 1st to April 30th = 30
Days from May 1st to May 31st = 31
Days from June 1st to June 30th = 30
Days from July 1st to July 31st = 31
Days from August 1st to August 31st = 31
Days from September 1st to September 30th = 30
Days from October 1st to October 31st = 31
Total days = 30 + 30 + 31 + 30 + 31 + 31 + 30 + 31 = 244
Remaining days = 270 - 244 = 26
November has 30 days.
26 days into November
So, November 26 will be 270 days from March 1st.
March 1 is a Monday.
March has 31 days.
31-1 = 30
April 30
May 31
June 30
July 31
Aug 31
Sep 30
Oct 31
270 days from March 1st, 244 days accounted for.
270 - 244 = 26
Days in November is 30.
26 days into November.
November 26 is the date.
Monday + 30(March)+ 30(April)+ 31(May) + 30(June) + 31(July) + 31(August) + 30(September)+31(October) = 244 days.
270-244 = 26 days into November.
Monday + (244 days)
244 days = 244 / 7 = 34 weeks, remainder 6 days
244 + 6 = 250 days
Monday + 6 days = Sunday
Final Answer: $\boxed{Sunday}$
ground_truth: Since there are $7$ days in a week, we first divide $270$ by $7$ to get $38 \text{ R}4$. Therefore, there are $38$ weeks and $4$ days in $270$ days. Since it is still Monday $38$ weeks after March 1, we consider the extra four days. Four days after a Monday is a $\boxed{\text{Friday}}$.
